clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Etoricoxib 60 mg and Diclofenac Sodium 150 mg in Patient With Osteoarthritis of the Knee or Hip

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the safety and tolerability of etoricoxib and diclofenac sodium in the treatment of osteoarthritis of the knee or hip during a six week period.

primary_outcome.measure: This study will assess the effectiveness of the study drug vs. a comparator to treat successfully OA-related joint pain (judged by WOMAC pain subscale).

secondary_outcome.measure: The study drug will be safe and well tolerated during the course of the study.

intervention.intervention_name: MK0663, etoricoxib / Duration of Treatment: 6 Weeks
Comparator: diclofenac sodium / Duration of Treatment: 6 Weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient is at least 40 years old and diagnosed with osteoarthritis of the knee or hip
- Has a history of treatment with NSAIDs with positive therapeutic benefit
- Agree to limit alcohol intake to less than 7 drinks per week and avoid unusual strenuous activity
- Females who are able to have children must have negative urine pregnancy tests
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has rheumatoid arthritis, lupus, Paget's disease affecting the study joint, or Wilson's disease
- History of acute ligament or meniscus damage to the study joint (knee or hip) within the past 2 years or arthroscopic surgery on the affected study joint with the past 6 months
- Requires joint replacement
